page.title: 01Farmland on Surrey/Kent Bor.
page.content: This is the first ruralarea south of London. Three quarters is in Surrey the rest in Kent. The southern slope of the North Downs is mainly covered by deciduous woodland. The more fertile valley, on the lower Greensand is partially cultivated but mainly grassland. There is a small residential area, a corner of Limpsfield, a peripheral dormitory area of London, other scatterd houses are mainly linked to 6 farms. One large Esatate, the Titsey Foundation Charitable Trust has woodland walks open to the public. Close to the A25 is a group of industrial firms producing, sand, mortar and roofing tiles. Recently a firm has been drilling to determine the extent of an oilfield discovered near Godstone.
